The geographical coverage is essentially limited to the Komi Republic territory located in the European part of Russia. Currently, all populations of
Heracleum sosnowskyi
in this area are invasive. This species was introduced into this region in the second half of the 20 th century as a forage crop. Since 2012 varieties of this species are excluded from the register of the breeding achievements of the Russian Federation (Official bulletin 2012; http://gossort.com/bullets/pdf/bull_176.pdf) . This species is also included in the “specialised catalogue of weeds” (Information letter 2015; http://antibor.ru/sites/526a0b00d7e1e49744000002/assets/56fa0dcdd7e1e4c087062929/pismo1-2.jpg).
